Browse the source code of netbsd/sys/external/bsd/acpica/dist/hardware/hwesleep.c

1/******************************************************************************
2 *
3 * Name: hwesleep.c - ACPI Hardware Sleep/Wake Support functions for the
4 * extended FADT-V5 sleep registers.
5 *
6 *****************************************************************************/
7

45#include "acpi.h"
46#include "accommon.h"
47
48#define _COMPONENT ACPI_HARDWARE
49 ACPI_MODULE_NAME ("hwesleep")
50
51
52/*******************************************************************************
53 *
54 * FUNCTION: AcpiHwExecuteSleepMethod
55 *
56 * PARAMETERS: MethodPathname - Pathname of method to execute
57 * IntegerArgument - Argument to pass to the method
58 *
59 * RETURN: None
60 *
61 * DESCRIPTION: Execute a sleep/wake related method with one integer argument
62 * and no return value.
63 *
64 ******************************************************************************/
65
66void
67AcpiHwExecuteSleepMethod (
68 char *MethodPathname,
69 UINT32 IntegerArgument)
70{
71 ACPI_OBJECT_LIST ArgList;
72 ACPI_OBJECT Arg;
73 ACPI_STATUS Status;
74
75
76 ACPI_FUNCTION_TRACE (HwExecuteSleepMethod);
77
78
79 /* One argument, IntegerArgument; No return value expected */
80
81 ArgList.Count = 1;
82 ArgList.Pointer = &Arg;
83 Arg.Type = ACPI_TYPE_INTEGER;
84 Arg.Integer.Value = (UINT64) IntegerArgument;
85
86 Status = AcpiEvaluateObject (NULL, MethodPathname, &ArgList, NULL);
87 if (ACPI_FAILURE (Status) && Status != AE_NOT_FOUND)
88 {
89 ACPI_EXCEPTION ((AE_INFO, Status, "While executing method %s",
90 MethodPathname));
91 }
92
93 return_VOID;
94}
95
96
97/*******************************************************************************
98 *
99 * FUNCTION: AcpiHwExtendedSleep
100 *
101 * PARAMETERS: SleepState - Which sleep state to enter
102 *
103 * RETURN: Status
104 *
105 * DESCRIPTION: Enter a system sleep state via the extended FADT sleep
106 * registers (V5 FADT).
107 * THIS FUNCTION MUST BE CALLED WITH INTERRUPTS DISABLED
108 *
109 ******************************************************************************/
110
111ACPI_STATUS
112AcpiHwExtendedSleep (
113 UINT8 SleepState)
114{
115 ACPI_STATUS Status;
116 UINT8 SleepControl;
117 UINT64 SleepStatus;
118
119
120 ACPI_FUNCTION_TRACE (HwExtendedSleep);
121
122
123 /* Extended sleep registers must be valid */
124
125 if (!AcpiGbl_FADT.SleepControl.Address ||
126 !AcpiGbl_FADT.SleepStatus.Address)
127 {
128 return_ACPI_STATUS (AE_NOT_EXIST);
129 }
130
131 /* Clear wake status (WAK_STS) */
132
133 Status = AcpiWrite ((UINT64) ACPI_X_WAKE_STATUS,
134 &AcpiGbl_FADT.SleepStatus);
135 if (ACPI_FAILURE (Status))
136 {
137 return_ACPI_STATUS (Status);
138 }
139
140 AcpiGbl_SystemAwakeAndRunning = FALSE;
141
142 /*
143 * Set the SLP_TYP and SLP_EN bits.
144 *
145 * Note: We only use the first value returned by the \_Sx method
146 * (AcpiGbl_SleepTypeA) - As per ACPI specification.
147 */
148 ACPI_DEBUG_PRINT ((ACPI_DB_INIT,
149 "Entering sleep state [S%u]\n", SleepState));
150
151 SleepControl = ((AcpiGbl_SleepTypeA << ACPI_X_SLEEP_TYPE_POSITION) &
152 ACPI_X_SLEEP_TYPE_MASK) | ACPI_X_SLEEP_ENABLE;
153
154 /* Flush caches, as per ACPI specification */
155
156 ACPI_FLUSH_CPU_CACHE ();
157
158 Status = AcpiOsEnterSleep (SleepState, SleepControl, 0);
159 if (Status == AE_CTRL_TERMINATE)
160 {
161 return_ACPI_STATUS (AE_OK);
162 }
163 if (ACPI_FAILURE (Status))
164 {
165 return_ACPI_STATUS (Status);
166 }
167
168 Status = AcpiWrite ((UINT64) SleepControl, &AcpiGbl_FADT.SleepControl);
169 if (ACPI_FAILURE (Status))
170 {
171 return_ACPI_STATUS (Status);
172 }
173
174 /* Wait for transition back to Working State */
175
176 do
177 {
178 Status = AcpiRead (&SleepStatus, &AcpiGbl_FADT.SleepStatus);
179 if (ACPI_FAILURE (Status))
180 {
181 return_ACPI_STATUS (Status);
182 }
183
184 } while (!(((UINT8) SleepStatus) & ACPI_X_WAKE_STATUS));
185
186 return_ACPI_STATUS (AE_OK);
187}
188
189
190/*******************************************************************************
191 *
192 * FUNCTION: AcpiHwExtendedWakePrep
193 *
194 * PARAMETERS: SleepState - Which sleep state we just exited
195 *
196 * RETURN: Status
197 *
198 * DESCRIPTION: Perform first part of OS-independent ACPI cleanup after
199 * a sleep. Called with interrupts ENABLED.
200 *
201 ******************************************************************************/
202
203ACPI_STATUS
204AcpiHwExtendedWakePrep (
205 UINT8 SleepState)
206{
207 ACPI_STATUS Status;
208 UINT8 SleepTypeValue;
209
210
211 ACPI_FUNCTION_TRACE (HwExtendedWakePrep);
212
213
214 Status = AcpiGetSleepTypeData (ACPI_STATE_S0,
215 &AcpiGbl_SleepTypeA, &AcpiGbl_SleepTypeB);
216 if (ACPI_SUCCESS (Status))
217 {
218 SleepTypeValue = ((AcpiGbl_SleepTypeA << ACPI_X_SLEEP_TYPE_POSITION) &
219 ACPI_X_SLEEP_TYPE_MASK);
220
221 (void) AcpiWrite ((UINT64) (SleepTypeValue | ACPI_X_SLEEP_ENABLE),
222 &AcpiGbl_FADT.SleepControl);
223 }
224
225 return_ACPI_STATUS (AE_OK);
226}
227
228
229/*******************************************************************************
230 *
231 * FUNCTION: AcpiHwExtendedWake
232 *
233 * PARAMETERS: SleepState - Which sleep state we just exited
234 *
235 * RETURN: Status
236 *
237 * DESCRIPTION: Perform OS-independent ACPI cleanup after a sleep
238 * Called with interrupts ENABLED.
239 *
240 ******************************************************************************/
241
242ACPI_STATUS
243AcpiHwExtendedWake (
244 UINT8 SleepState)
245{
246 ACPI_FUNCTION_TRACE (HwExtendedWake);
247
248
249 /* Ensure EnterSleepStatePrep -> EnterSleepState ordering */
250
251 AcpiGbl_SleepTypeA = ACPI_SLEEP_TYPE_INVALID;
252
253 /* Execute the wake methods */
254
255 AcpiHwExecuteSleepMethod (__UNCONST(METHOD_PATHNAME__SST), ACPI_SST_WAKING);
256 AcpiHwExecuteSleepMethod (__UNCONST(METHOD_PATHNAME__WAK), SleepState);
257
258 /*
259 * Some BIOS code assumes that WAK_STS will be cleared on resume
260 * and use it to determine whether the system is rebooting or
261 * resuming. Clear WAK_STS for compatibility.
262 */
263 (void) AcpiWrite ((UINT64) ACPI_X_WAKE_STATUS, &AcpiGbl_FADT.SleepStatus);
264 AcpiGbl_SystemAwakeAndRunning = TRUE;
265
266 AcpiHwExecuteSleepMethod (__UNCONST(METHOD_PATHNAME__SST), ACPI_SST_WORKING);
267 return_ACPI_STATUS (AE_OK);
268}
